segment.target: description: Getting started: What next?

segment.source: title: Getting started: What next?
segment.target: title: Getting started: What next?

segment.source: Getting started: What next?
segment.target: Getting started: What next?

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: With this basic information, you can now start writing more interesting Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: With this basic information, you can now start writing more interesting Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: For your next steps, have a read through the following topics, and then fire up Microsoft Visual Studio and start writing some code!
segment.target: For your next steps, have a read through the following topics, and then fire up Microsoft Visual Studio and start writing some code!

segment.source: App contracts and extensions: How to declare agreements between your apps and other apps and Windows, for example, the Play To contract and the Game Explorer extension.
segment.target: App contracts and extensions: How to declare agreements between your apps and other apps and Windows, for example, the Play To contract and the Game Explorer extension.

segment.source: Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications: How to create tiles, update tiles and their badges, send toast notifications, and show and update tile and badge updates on the lock screen.
segment.target: Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications: How to create tiles, update tiles and their badges, send toast notifications, and show and update tile and badge updates on the lock screen.

segment.source: Launching, resuming, and multitasking: How to auto-launch, activate, suspend, and resume apps, and how to work with background tasks.
segment.target: Launching, resuming, and multitasking: How to auto-launch, activate, suspend, and resume apps, and how to work with background tasks.

segment.source: Guidelines for roaming application data: How to provide a great end-user experience for apps where the user utilizes more than one device, such as a PC at work and a tablet at home.
segment.target: Guidelines for roaming application data: How to provide a great end-user experience for apps where the user utilizes more than one device, such as a PC at work and a tablet at home.

segment.source: Create your first Windows Runtime app using C# or Visual Basic: A topic focusing on Windows Phone development.
segment.target: Create your first Windows Runtime app using C# or Visual Basic: A topic focusing on Windows Phone development.

segment.source: Videos for iOS and Android devs: Some more help, this time in visual format.
segment.target: Videos for iOS and Android devs: Some more help, this time in visual format.

segment.source: Also, be sure to visit our Community resources to learn how to get help and get connected through developer forums, blogs, developer camps and workshops, and local Microsoft events and contacts.
segment.target: Also, be sure to visit our Community resources to learn how to get help and get connected through developer forums, blogs, developer camps and workshops, and local Microsoft events and contacts.

segment.source: We think that Windows 10 will open up new app-building opportunities for you.
segment.target: We think that Windows 10 will open up new app-building opportunities for you.

segment.source: We look forward to seeing all of the great apps that you're going to build!
segment.target: We look forward to seeing all of the great apps that you're going to build!
